paragraph.heading: 1Using ENViSioN! within Visual Studio.Net
paragraph.paragraph: One of the things that makes Microsoft .NET special is the openness of the environment. It welcomes programming languages of all sorts by providing a common intermediate language and a standard execution environment. Components originating in any number of languages can work together without any "glue".

That same spirit of openness applies to Visual Studio .NET as well. Languages that run in the Microsoft .NET environment can also have design-time support in Visual Studio .NET. Eiffel ENViSioN! is Visual Studio .NET design-time support for the Eiffel for .NET language.

If you have prior experience developing in Visual Studio, particularly in the .NET version of Visual Studio using Visual Basic .NET and/or Visual C# .NET, much of the information detailed in these pages will look familiar to you.

Of course Eiffel for .NET is different from C# and VB.NET with capabilities not present in other .NET languages. If it were not different in some significant way, then there would be no reason for it to exist. So depending upon your experience, you may have two things to learn.
The mechanics of using ENViSioN! to support the creation of Eiffel for .NET software, documented in the topics referenced below.
The Eiffel method and language and how they work with Microsoft .NET, found in
\20_Language\index.xml Eiffel, The Language .
